jsonData.title: Amazon pushing hard into ocean shipping, making it easier for Chinese goods to get to you
jsonData.subtitle: Quietly and below the radar, Amazon has been ramping up its ocean shipping service, sending close to 4.7 million cartons of consumers goods from China to the United States over the past year, records show.

jsonData.title: U.S.-China trade war has cost up to 245,000 U.S. jobs: business group study
jsonData.subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump’s trade war with China has caused a peak loss of 245,000 U.S. jobs, but a gradual scaling back of tariffs on both sides would boost growth and lead to an additional 145,000 jobs by 2025, a study commissioned by the U.S.-China Business Council (USCBC) shows

jsonData.title: Federal Reserve raises interest rates despite pressure from the President
jsonData.subtitle: Fed said rates will rise a quarter of a percentage point to 2.25% to 2.5% but it is carefully watching ‘event risks’, including Brexit. The US Federal Reserve raised interest rates again on Wednesday despite intense, and unprecedented, pressure from Donald Trump to leave rates unchanged.
